alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 12:58AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washita, northwestern Caddo and southeastern Custer Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1258 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Weatherford, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Corn, and Colony. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 72 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
